snippet: Bills that would allow check-cashing stores to enter the lending business and be exempt from the usury law are a bad idea.
abstract: Editorial calls on New York Gov Andrew Cuomo to take strong stance against pending bills that encourage predatory payday lenders, who often charge rates of 500 percent or more to borrowers; says ultimate solution is to bring affordable financial services to poor neighborhoods.
lead_paragraph: Bills that would allow check-cashing stores to enter the lending business and be exempt from the usury law are a bad idea.

headline.seo: Gouging the Poor in New York
headline.main: Gouging the Poor in New York
headline.print_headline: Gouging the Poor in New York
